title: Kate Middleton Mixed Pakistani and British Labels During Last Day of the Royal Tour of Pakistan
text:
Looks like Kate Middleton is ending her royal tour of Pakistan the same way she started it—in style, of course.

The Duchess of Cambridge had a busy fifth and final day on Friday, and opted to dress in both Pakistani and British labels. Seems fitting.

The duke and duchess began their day by departing from Lahore Airport, where Middleton rocked a cream kurta by Elan (not available to the public until later this year) which featured navy blue piping. She paired the look with white trousers and nude J. Crew ‘Lucie’ high heels.

See the full look below.

Perhaps the best part of the ensemble? Her Smythson Panama East West Zip Tote.

The roomy bag isn’t what we're used to the duchess carrying, as she usually opts for a nude clutch or teeny evening bags. However, we love this choice—especially for a day full of travel.

In the afternoon, the royal couple played with puppies on a visit to Islamabad’s Army Canine Centre.

The duchess rocked a Papilio black coat-dress by Beulah London paired with a white kurta underneath and a pair of Russell & Bromley black flats. Maybe not our first choice for puppy playing but hey, we’re no duchess.

Now that’s how you end a royal tour.
